executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Mark and Michael pitched Knife Aid, a mail-in knife sharpening service, seeking $400,000 for 15% equity. After several offers and negotiations among the Sharks, Lori Greiner and Rohan Oza secured a deal for $500,000 for 20%, following an intense bidding and hallway negotiation.
keyDecisions: Knife Aid accepted a joint offer from Lori Greiner and Rohan Oza for $500,000 in exchange for 20% equity.
